intro: Gnidia thesioides var. laxa, commonly known as the soft-stemmed gnidia, is a South African plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by birds and mammals. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
